titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Photographs of houses in Sea Gate V1990.023
titlestmt.author: Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:21:34 +0000.

did.unittitle: Photographs of houses in Sea Gate
did.abstract: The Photographs of houses in Sea Gate consist of two black-and-white photographic prints depicting two different houses located in the Sea Gate neighborhood of Brooklyn, circa 1900 to 1920. Both photographs were taken during the day and show exterior views of the houses, along with their surrounding landscaped lawns. One photographic shows a group of people playing croquet on the lawn outside one of the houses, circa 1900.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Photographs of houses in Sea Gate consist of two black-and-white photographic prints depicting two different houses located in the Sea Gate neighborhood of Brooklyn, circa 1900 to 1920. Both photographs were taken during the day and show exterior views of the houses, along with their surrounding landscaped lawns. One photographic shows a group of people playing croquet on the lawn outside one of the houses, circa 1900.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governging Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for anonymously created items remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. Based on the date range of this collection, the photographs will enter the public domain in 2040. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library. Please consult library staff for more information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Photographs of houses in Sea Gate, V1990.023, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Rye Historical Society, 1990. The photographs were originally donated to the Rye Historical Society from Agatha Alling Durland.
